metadata.title: CVE-2019-11191 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** The Linux kernel through 5.0.7, when CONFIG_IA32_AOUT isenabled and ia32_aout is loaded, allows local users to bypass ASLR onsetuid a.out programs (if any exist) because install_exec_creds() is calledtoo late in load_aout_binary() in fs/binfmt_aout.c, and thus theptrace_may_access() check has a race condition when reading /proc/pid/stat.NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability becauseASLR for a.out format executables has never been supported.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required
